clinical_study.brief_title: Reproductive Health in Men and Women With Vasculitis
clinical_study.official_title: Reproductive Health in Men and Women With Vasculitis

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to learn about reproductive health, including fertility and pregnancies, in people with vasculitis.

detailed_description.textblock: All patients enrolled in the Vasculitis Clinical Research Consortium's Contact Registry were invited via email to participate in this study. The Contract Registry includes people who self-identify as having one of 6 vasculitities: Wegener's Granulomatosis, Microscopic Polyangiitis, Churg-Strauss Syndrome, Polyarteritis Nodosum, Takayasu's Arteritis, and Giant Cell Arteritis. People voluntarily enroll in this Registry with the understanding that they will receive information about clinical studies for which they might be eligible. The introductory email included basic information about the study and all of the required elements for informed consent in a brief format. By clicking the link to the reproductive health questionnaire, participants gave their consent to be included in the study.

primary_outcome.measure: The rate of infertility with and without prior cyc.
primary_outcome.time_frame: 1 year after the study is closed to enrollment

secondary_outcome.measure: The rate of pregnancy complications in pregnancies delivered before and after vasculitis diagnosis.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 1 year after the study is closed to enrollment

study_pop.textblock: All patients with vasculitis included in the VCRC Contact Registry were invited to participate. Data was included for all patients who provided a vasculitis diagnosis, estimated date of diagnosis, confirmed that the diagnosis was made by a rheumatologist, and reported having taken at least one appropriate anti-rheumatic medication. Other participants were excluded as the likelihood that they have a true vasculitis condition is low.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Enrolled in VCRC Contact Registry
- Patient reported diagnosis of Wegener's Granulomatosis, Microscopic Polyangiitis, Churg-Strauss Syndrome, Polyarteritis Nodosa, Takayasu's Arteritis, Giant Cell Arteritis, Behcet's Disease, Kawasaki Disease, Henoch-Schoenlein Purpura, CNS or Drug-induced Vasculitis
- 18 years of age or older
- English speaking
Exclusion Criteria:
- Inability to provide informed consent and complete survey
